> Smiling as fruit of his efforts now stood before him. A tall and beu=
tiful thing, a worthy follower and companion. He watched as she tested her =
weaponry, becoming familiar now with his new body. Now they were a force to=
 be reckoned with. 
> =A0
> "We return, but to a precarious world. WHat we =
do here will last to the future, our pasts. We must preserve this little wo=
rld, or everything will be gone. The descendants of the Decepticns and the =
Autobots quarrel mindlessly, make changes to this world for their own gain.=
 For the Decepticon EMpire to have a future, we must make safe it's past. B=
ut we must not be hasty, we should use these fools for all they are worth b=
efore putting an end to them."
> 
> 

Listening to him as she glanced at he=
r weapons, then retracted them. Looking at him with those cold crimson opti=
cs, her faceplate blank with no expression. 
She was completely back! 

"Hm=
mm... indeed a delimma," she stated in her deep femme voice, pausing but a =
moment, "But surely nothing we can't handle," as a wicked smirk crossed tho=
se metallic lips. Well beyond into this future which had taken them into th=
eir past, she was an older Decepticon but felt out of place nonetheless. Th=
e future of her comrades in arms and her beloved Leader lay in her's and Me=
gatron X's hands. 

Nodding one, "Very well. Have you any ideas? Plans?"
Sl=
owly, those memories contained with the nucleus of the spark seeped into he=
r new meta-processor. Reformating those memories into what was at what time=
 in her existance. All the way from her creation and Aide to the Defense Co=
rps, coming to know Megatron as he rose to power from a gladiator to leader=
 of a new army... all the way til recently when she had been reformatted in=
to a transorganic, escaped from Cybertron, came here and met up with Hydras=
 and his faction of Predacons. 
Hydras. 
Those recent memories filtered in.=
 But the emotion that once supported their fancy for one another... was no =
longer there. Indeed she was right, the organic side of her did cause more =
of a non-cybertron personality within her. Ever so glad she no longer had t=
o deal with that pathetic form any longer. 

Her optics remained upon Megat=
ron X. Pleased that she was at least back in the presense of a Decepticon. =
Or so he claimed. 
Now the curiosity welled within her. She wanted to know =
more about this mech who stood before her, who retrieved her and brought he=
r back to the land of moving parts. Ever so grateful for his assistance and=
 dedication. But she had learned long ago... that though one may possess th=
e name of Megatron, does not mean he IS Megatron.
She will have to test him=
.
